http://www.insidesocialgames.com/2010/01/28/a-look-at-the-app-ecosystem-on-china%E2%80%99s-renren-com/

had quite a cool day at work. 
finally feel like i'm part of the group now. i got my own little memo on the project board and i promised to finish the basic functions of my project by friday afternoon.

the morning i spent trying to display all the children of a parent object. the sort of problem and trick working with php and SQL is that all the data is stored in databases, in tables, which allows a representation of class and objects but requires some trickery to get around it. instead of just printing a variable, it requires some SQL statements to find the right variables within that huge table.
 
afternoon was spent trying to add the "add" functionality across all the classes.
the sort of problem is similar to the one doing a tree. you don't have access to the parent's properties but you need someway of getting them to store it for future extraction purposes.
again, it was done through trickery, taking advantage of the fact everything sort of works in a flow-like manner. so some variables are defined here and don't quite get killed until much later on. etc, the OOP paradigm is not as clear in the php code.

some php specific commands i learnt
<?php ?> adding php functions in html
trim() - taking white space
print_r() - print contents
a? b : c - if a is true, then takes on value of b, otherwise, takes on value of c
php has a really nice set of tools to use with sQL databases. this PDO stuff is pretty nice.
